commit.message: Update release notes for 2.4.4
Bump version to 2.4.4
PostgresSQL 16 support

Cleanup shadow warnings

Avoid warning messages like

warning: declaration of ‘foo’ shadows a previous local
Update release notes for 2.4.3
Bump version to 2.4.3

Apply data filtering on the correct tuple during initial sync (#387)

Apply data filtering on the correct tuple during initial sync

Formerly, we just used the original retrieved tuple in
pglogical_table_data_filtered() to initially sync a table. This
caused us to probably miss not yet materialized tuple column
values, like it happens if a column value is not yet materialized
when having pg_attribute.atthasmissing set after adding a column
with a non-null DEFAULT expression since PG11.

To fix this, deform the tuple and use a proper new version with
all column values replaced before filtering and storing it
into the tuplestore.

---------

Co-authored-by: Euler Taveira <euler.taveira@enterprisedb.com>

Apply data filtering on the correct tuple during initial sync (#387)

Apply data filtering on the correct tuple during initial sync

Formerly, we just used the original retrieved tuple in
pglogical_table_data_filtered() to initially sync a table. This
caused us to probably miss not yet materialized tuple column
values, like it happens if a column value is not yet materialized
when having pg_attribute.atthasmissing set after adding a column
with a non-null DEFAULT expression since PG11.

To fix this, deform the tuple and use a proper new version with
all column values replaced before filtering and storing it
into the tuplestore.

---------

Co-authored-by: Euler Taveira <euler.taveira@enterprisedb.com>

commit.message:
Fix missing restore of memory context in pg_decode_change()

Change c53a83c22a29d71ded6316e02a21fc1c84c9f60a forgot to include
cleanup for early exit case. Fixes #419

Remove files left from a previous build

If you are using the same source code to build with multiple Postgres
versions, a previous build (that didn't execute 'make clean') could
possibly left an object file and LLVM bitcode file.

Don't replicate truncate as global message

The TRUNCATE command needs to respect the replication sets.

RT87453

Link directly to "Limitations and restrictions" section

This provides more convenient navigation, and avoids confusion when I break this readme up into sections for EDB Docs
Fixes https://github.com/EnterpriseDB/docs/issues/4026

Drop database never completes in Postgres 15 (#403)

Postgres 15 introduced a signal barrier for DROP DATABASE
(4eb2176318d0561846c1f9fb3c68bede799d640f). pglogical has no logic to
handle it in the supervisor code. Add CFI to fix it.

Fix #399

handle it in the supervisor code. Add CFI to fix it.

Fix #399

commit.message: PostgreSQL 15 support

[pglogical2] Fix system header files (#355)

* Move system includes after postgres.h

This is the standard coding rule for extensions, also followed by
other files in pglogical, except this one.

* Include arpa/inet.h explicitly where needed

This is needed here for htons() and htonl().  It was sometimes
provided via header files from PostgreSQL depending on configure
results, but this was never reliable or correct, so do it explicitly.

BDR-2620

[pglogical2] Fix system header files (#355)

* Move system includes after postgres.h

This is the standard coding rule for extensions, also followed by
other files in pglogical, except this one.

* Include arpa/inet.h explicitly where needed

This is needed here for htons() and htonl().  It was sometimes
provided via header files from PostgreSQL depending on configure
results, but this was never reliable or correct, so do it explicitly.

BDR-2620

commit.message:
Setup signal handler before we unblock signals

The default SIGTERM signal handler implemented by Postgres for
background worker processes throws a FATAL error in the handler itself.
This is not in sync with rest of the system where we generally process
signals out-of-line. This is important because the process might be in a
middle of updating shared memory or holding a spinlock and if the
process exits without a clean state, may lead to issues.

One of our customers reported a "Stuck spinlock" PANIC, which was
tracked down to this. While it might be a good idea to fix the default
signal handler in Postgres, for now, work it around by setting up our
handler before we unblock the signals. This is how other processes work
and is the right thing to do.
Update release notes for 2.4.1

Include PG 14 pkgs description

in README.
Also update to latest customer repository information to access pkgs.
BDR-1682

Remove files left from a previous build

If you are using the same source code to build with multiple Postgres
versions, a previous build (that didn't execute 'make clean') could
possibly left an object file and LLVM bitcode file.

Snapshot handling fixes

Per issue #343, pglogical2 should obtain a snapshot before reading a
tuple. That's because a machinery could expect an active snapshot to
execute some code (see new test case) before actually inserting the row.
Rearrange PushActiveSnapshot and PopActiveSnapshot calls to cover those
cases too. It seems the previous commits
(17a83481661e531669d6904920a9109424fa3339 and
bd2e972dca9a9fdb7a5ae88f41780fc24ade8632) didn't consider this case.

This bug affects all supported Postgres versions.

Fix issue #343.

Snapshot is still active warning

Commit 17a83481661e531669d6904920a9109424fa3339 moved
PushActiveSnapshot() into init_apply_exec_state() but forgot to
remove it from pglogical_apply_heap_update() and
pglogical_apply_heap_delete().

Fix issue #336.
Bump version to 2.4.1

commit.message: flush error state when failed to drop remote replication slot
Update release notes for 2.4.0

Increase more timeouts in test

There are more parts of add_table that wait for table resync,
adjust timeout for all of them.
Bump version to 2.4.0
PostgreSQL 14 support

Add replorigin_drop_by_name()

Refactor origin lookup and drop into a common function
replorigin_drop_by_name().  This matches the API introduced by
PostgreSQL 14.
